column4: i just installed ubuntu 9.04 amd64 on top of 9.04 amd64 (same version) because i was having technical problems (a whole host of things, the last straw being refusing to boot)
now it will boot but when i log in i see first the gnome toolbars briefly, then white
a full screen of white, which alllows me to do nothing because i can't see, though there does seem to be one window open, because when i zoom out on the compiz cube i see it's outline
and suggestiongs for getting it to work? i think it's a problem of conflicting settings with the fresh installation...
*suggestions
why did you reibnstall?
it wouldn't boot: got past the graphic ubutnu boot bar and then froze, flashing twice a strange graphically messed up thing, then staying on a third
did you format the partition when yo ureinstalled?
the root, yes, but not the home
well try making a new user and not reusing your probably broken old home dir
i should also mention i had been using the / previously as ext4
it doent matter what / was as long asy ou formated it
well i think it was never actually formatted as ext4, just i had set it to treat it as ext4, while it was actually ext3... so could that be holding over?
if you are installing, you must select the optino to format the partition
how can i create a new user from the command line?
useradd
ok thanks i'll try that now...
i highly doubt you have a virus
i know it's weird but it doesn't seem to be affecting the router... as the other computers in this lab (hostel) are not getting redirects
wait it could be an extension i recently installed...
lol
as chrome isn't having any probs either
i've developed a rather lax trust level with anything that's on addons.mozilla
